                    <title>Lena Dunham had hysterectomy after years of pain</title>
                    <link> https://www.thespec.com/living-story/8139473-lena-dunham-had-hysterectomy-after-years-of-pain/ </link>						                                                 				                                             

					  <description><img alt="
Lena Dunham 
" src="http://media.zuza.com/0/1/012442cf-d57e-453d-b312-5616b07ed79a/B8861739Z.1_20180216134949_000_GJR37IC0.3-0_Content.jpg" /><p>Actress and writer Lena Dunham reveals in a new published essay that she had a hysterectomy last fall at age 31.</p></description>

				<item>
                    <title>Could Joffrey have been saved?</title>
                    <link> https://www.thespec.com/living-story/8137402-could-joffrey-have-been-saved-/ </link>						                                                 				                                             

					  <description><img alt="
“Game of Thrones” fans shed few tears over the poisoning death of King Joffrey I Baratheon. His TV death has been used as a real life medical case study.
" src="http://media.zuza.com/6/1/61600e5e-d74e-474d-85c6-948836983e09/B8861705Z.1_20180215175324_000_G6536BUS.4-0_Content.jpg" /><p> “Game of Thrones” fans may have shed few tears over the poisoning death of King Joffrey I Baratheon, a nasty character if ever there was one. But could real-world medicine have saved the young monarch?</p></description>
                                    <category><![CDATA[ WhatsOn ]]></category>         
                                    <category><![CDATA[ Living ]]></category>

				<item>
                    <title>Scientists discover soil-dwelling bacteria may fight drug-resistant superbugs </title>

					  <description>It’s a new class of antibiotic that promises to live up to its rough Latin translation: killer of bad guys.</p></description>

Lerone Bennett Jr.

				<item>
                    <title>Coping with cold sores</title>
                    <link> https://www.thespec.com/living-story/8137198-coping-with-cold-sores/ </link>						                                                 				                                             

					  <description>Cold sores — also called fever blisters — are a common viral infection. They are tiny, fluid-filled blisters on and around your lips. These blisters are often grouped together in patches. After the blisters break, a crust forms over the resulting sore. Cold sores usually heal in two to four weeks without leaving a scar.</p></description>
                                    <category><![CDATA[ Living ]]></category>         
                                    <category><![CDATA[ Living/Health ]]></category>         
    
                                                                         
                     <pubDate>Thu, 15 Feb 2018 11:42:03 -0500 </pubDate> 

                     <creator><![CDATA[  ]]></creator> 
                     <guid>https://www.thespec.com/living-story/8137198-coping-with-cold-sores/</guid>                        				
                </item>

				<item>
                    <title>Research predicts, prevents injuries in athletes</title>
                    <link> https://www.thespec.com/living-story/8134548-research-predicts-prevents-injuries-in-athletes/ </link>						                                                 				                                             

					  <description>For the past 11 years, a team of physicians and researchers at Mayo Clinic has been collecting data from athletes in an attempt to predict and prevent running injuries.</p></description>

                </item>
				<item>
                    <title>The painkiller, Acetaminophen, may disrupt sex hormones — placing unborn babies at risk</title>
                    <link> https://www.thespec.com/living-story/8132139-the-painkiller-acetaminophen-may-disrupt-sex-hormones-placing-unborn-babies-at-risk/ </link>						                                                 				                                             

					  <description><img alt="
 Pharmacy shelves with a variety of painkillers
" src="http://media.zuza.com/c/8/c83f5399-601a-49c2-b5c6-57000627be87/B8859136Z.1_20180214125116_000_GN633S2F.3-0_Content.jpg" /><p>Use of the painkiller acetaminophen during pregnancy may cause harmful sex hormone abnormalities, according to a study led by San Diego researchers.</p></description>
                                    <category><![CDATA[ Living ]]></category>         
                                    <category><![CDATA[ Living/Health ]]></category>         
    
                                                                         
                     <pubDate>Wed, 14 Feb 2018 12:52:04 -0500 </pubDate> 

                     <creator><![CDATA[  ]]></creator> 
                     <guid>https://www.thespec.com/living-story/8132139-the-painkiller-acetaminophen-may-disrupt-sex-hormones-placing-unborn-babies-at-risk/</guid>                        				
                </item>
				<item>
                    <title>A potentially powerful new antibiotic is discovered in dirt</title>
                    <link> https://www.thespec.com/living-story/8132468-a-potentially-powerful-new-antibiotic-is-discovered-in-dirt/ </link>						                                                 				                                             

					  <description><img alt="
Scientists examined 2,000 soils and found a new class or antibiotics that can defeat MRSA and other drug-resistant superbugs. 
" src="http://media.zuza.com/2/1/2160509b-8874-4c67-97f1-e854fd9a1339/B8859414Z.1_20180214125148_000_GO53491B.3-0_Content.jpg" /><p>The modern medical era began when an absent-minded British science named Alexander Fleming returned from vacation to find that one of the petri dishes he forgot to put away was covered in a bacteria-killing mould. He had discovered penicillin, the world's first antibiotic.</p></description>
                                    <category><![CDATA[ Living ]]></category>         
                                    <category><![CDATA[ Living/Health ]]></category>         
    
                                                                         
                     <pubDate>Wed, 14 Feb 2018 12:52:04 -0500 </pubDate> 

                     <creator><![CDATA[ Sarah Kaplan  ]]></creator> 
                     <guid>https://www.thespec.com/living-story/8132468-a-potentially-powerful-new-antibiotic-is-discovered-in-dirt/</guid>                        				
                </item>
				<item>
                    <title>She thought the weird sensation was a stray eyelash. It was eye worms</title>
                    <link> https://www.thespec.com/living-story/8134124-she-thought-the-weird-sensation-was-a-stray-eyelash-it-was-eye-worms/ </link>						                                                 				                                             

					  <description><img alt="Abby Beckley in 2015 on a hike near her home in Bend, Oregon. She is the first human known to have been infected with a rare eye worm found in cows." src="http://media.zuza.com/9/1/917a6187-7f06-45c8-bac9-810d91ada262/B8860568Z.1_20180214125142_000_G1735DPH.3-0_Content.jpg" /><p>Abby Beckley thought her left eye was irritated because of a stray eyelash. She rubbed her eye, flushed it with water, but when the discomfort remained, she peered into the mirror. She thought she saw a piece of clear fuzz. She pinched it with her fingers and pulled it out.</p></description>
                                    <category><![CDATA[ News ]]></category>         
                                    <category><![CDATA[ Living ]]></category>         
                                    <category><![CDATA[ Living/Health ]]></category>         
    
                                                                         
                     <pubDate>Wed, 14 Feb 2018 12:52:04 -0500 </pubDate> 

                     <creator><![CDATA[ Lena H. Sun  ]]></creator> 
                     <guid>https://www.thespec.com/living-story/8134124-she-thought-the-weird-sensation-was-a-stray-eyelash-it-was-eye-worms/</guid>                        				
                </item>
    </channel>
